title: Banach–Mazur compactum
summary: In the mathematical study of functional analysis, the Banach–Mazur distance is a way to define a distance on the set Q ( n ) {\displaystyle Q(n)} of n {\displaystyle n} -dimensional normed spaces. With this distance, the set of isometry classes of n {\displaystyle n} -dimensional normed spaces becomes a compact metric space, called the Banach–Mazur compactum.
